March 14-1919
Dear Ellen:
Will write you again to night. I have started several times this week to write you But something happened every time.
I got one wrote a few nights ago and one of the boys came in and turned a bottle of ink over all over it so I had to burn it up.
Last night Lin came down to see me and of course we had to talk over old times. I am always so glad to
have Lin come around We talk of all the good times we have had and wonder when we can get back to have some more good times.
I believe Lin will beat me home. That is the way things look now. I have give up all hopes of getting home before August or sept.
They wont even tell us when they think
wwe will get home. You ask me what Div. I am in here. We dont belong to any Div at all.
We are just over here and I thank they have forgot we are here.
We never have been in a Div just plain old 23 Engrs
Say let me tell you something funny it has not rained
here in four days now can you amagine such a thing And the sun has been shining those four days.
We are having real spring weather and I am sure glad to see it.
Say Lin was telling me last night about some one driving the car off from the dance and all of you being left in the rain Some joke
I will bet I can guess what you said about the fellow that done that
We are having a dance here in Sauelly to night but I wouldnt go if I never got to go to another dance in my life
There is about ten men to ever girl Well I dont like to be around a place like that.
I can tell you all about these dances over here when I get home
Well I hope to here from you again real soon. I have received one letter from you in three week
Of course if you was sick I can excuse But write me real often
With lots of love
James L Dodds
